Sentencas: The oxides of the SrCo1-xSbxO3-delta perovskite family have been recently designed, characterized and described as cathode materials for solid-oxide fuel cells with competitive power performance in the temperature range 750-850 degrees
Titulo: Evolution of cobalt spin states and magnetic coupling along the SrCo1-xSbxO3-δ system: correlation with the crystal structure
Evolution of cobalt spin states and magnetic coupling along the SrCo1-xSbxO3-δ system: correlation with the crystal structure

Sentencas: They feature a number of interesting properties including a good electronic conductivity, low electrode polarization resistance and adequate thermal expansion; the crystal structure adopts a 3C corner-linked perovskite network with a considerable number of oxygen vacancies.
Titulo: Evolution of cobalt spin states and magnetic coupling along the SrCo1-xSbxO3-δ system: correlation with the crystal structure

Sentencas: This paper reports on the effects of Sb-doping on the crystal structure features, the Co oxidation state and magnetic properties related to the presence of spin-state transitions in the Co cations.
Titulo: Evolution of cobalt spin states and magnetic coupling along the SrCo1-xSbxO3-δ system: correlation with the crystal structure

Sentencas: A phase transition was observed from the tetragonal P4/mmm space group for x <= 0.15 to the cubic Pm (3) over barm space group in the x = 0.2 composition from neutron powder diffraction data.
Titulo: Evolution of cobalt spin states and magnetic coupling along the SrCo1-xSbxO3-δ system: correlation with the crystal structure

Sentencas: For the tetragonal phases the oxygen vacancies were found to be ordered and localized in the axial O2 and equatorial O3 atoms surrounding the Co2 positions.
Titulo: Evolution of cobalt spin states and magnetic coupling along the SrCo1-xSbxO3-δ system: correlation with the crystal structure

Sentencas: A noticeable distortion of CoO6 octahedra is observed for x = 0.05 and 0.1, exhibiting a charge-ordering with a mixed oxidation state of Co3+/(4+) at Co1 sites and Co3+ at Co2 positions: the Jahn-Teller Co3+ in an intermediate-spin configuration is responsible for the octahedral distortion.
Titulo: Evolution of cobalt spin states and magnetic coupling along the SrCo1-xSbxO3-δ system: correlation with the crystal structure

Sentencas: Increasing Sb contents promotes a higher average oxidation state of cobalt, from a valence of 3.2+ for x = 0.05 to 3.4+ for x = 0.2, inducing a decrease of the oxygen vacancies and favouring a random distribution over a Pm (3) over barm cubic symmetry.
Titulo: Evolution of cobalt spin states and magnetic coupling along the SrCo1-xSbxO3-δ system: correlation with the crystal structure

Sentencas: All the samples present an antiferromagnetic behaviour with a G-type (k = 0) magnetic structure.
Titulo: Evolution of cobalt spin states and magnetic coupling along the SrCo1-xSbxO3-δ system: correlation with the crystal structure

Sentencas: The increase of the Sb content induces the weakening of the crystal field (Delta(cf)) in the octahedral environment promoting the Co spin-transition from the intermediate-spin to the high-spin configuration, as evidenced by the decrease of the octahedral distortion, increment of the unit-cell volume and enhancement of the ordered magnetic moment.
Titulo: Evolution of cobalt spin states and magnetic coupling along the SrCo1-xSbxO3-δ system: correlation with the crystal structure
